weather.special_conditions: Extreme downslope winds, record low fuel moisture

documented_conditions.fuel_type: Mixed conifer forest with manzanita chaparral understory

what_works.finding: Model successfully captured downslope wind dynamics (65 km/h)
Model handles record low fuel moisture (5%) adequately
Model predicts 28k ha California fires reasonably well
what_works.evidence: Contrast with Palisades (7k ha) overprediction and Fort McMurray (85k ha) underprediction

what_needs_improvement.finding: Model underpredicts by 20% - could be improved to <10%
what_needs_improvement.root_cause: C7 fuel type may slightly underestimate mixed conifer/chaparral intensity

lessons_learned.lesson: Model performs well for California fires at 20-30k ha scale
lessons_learned.implication: Scale dependency is more nuanced than initially thought

lessons_learned.lesson: Small California fires overpredict (Palisades 109%), large ones are accurate (Camp 20%)
lessons_learned.implication: Different mechanisms at different scales - not linear relationship

lessons_learned.lesson: Record low fuel moisture (5%) is well-captured by high FFMC (97)
lessons_learned.implication: Model handles outlier conditions better than expected

lessons_learned.lesson: Downslope winds are adequately modeled by wind speed parameter
lessons_learned.implication: No special downslope wind model needed

lessons_learned.lesson: C7 is acceptable analog for mixed conifer/chaparral at this scale
lessons_learned.implication: Custom chaparral model (FUEL_001) is lower priority for fires >20k ha

improvement_recommendations.title: Refine C7 parameters for mixed conifer/chaparral
improvement_recommendations.description: Fine-tune C7 fuel type to better represent California mixed conifer with chaparral understory
improvement_recommendations.expected_improvement: Reduce Camp Fire error from 20% to <10%

california_scale_dependency.mega_fires_62k_ha: Unknown (Camp Fire final perimeter not tested)

canadian_vs_california.observation: Model performs surprisingly well across ecosystems at similar scales

overall_pattern.recommendation: Focus on extreme scales (mega-fires >50k ha, small fires <10k ha)
